interface_implementations.description: Have a box for each item in list_2 and let the user drop each item from list_1 into the correct box.
interface_implementations.learning_reinforcement: Reinforces understanding of categories by requiring direct, kinesthetic association.

interface_implementations.description: Tell the user which ammo type is loaded in his gun, that is only effective against certain types of targets (e.g., 'Fruit ammo' for 'Fruit' targets).
interface_implementations.learning_reinforcement: Encourages quick identification and classification under pressure in a gamified context.

interface_implementations.description: Display all items from list_1 and list_2, and have the user draw lines or click to connect correct pairs.
interface_implementations.learning_reinforcement: Strengthens memory and recognition of associations through visual pairing.

interface_implementations.description: For each item in list_1, ask the user to choose its category from list_2 as multiple-choice options.
interface_implementations.learning_reinforcement: Tests recall and understanding of classifications in a structured, familiar format.

interface_implementations.description: Present two columns, one for each category in list_2. The user must move all items from an unsorted list into the correct column.
interface_implementations.learning_reinforcement: Develops organizational skills by physically grouping multiple items into their respective categories.

interface_implementations.description: Show the user an item from list_1 and an empty text field. The user must type the correct category from list_2.
interface_implementations.learning_reinforcement: Promotes active recall and correct spelling, as the user must generate the answer from memory instead of just recognizing it.

interface_implementations.description: Create a grid of face-down cards. Some cards contain items from list_1, others from list_2. Users flip two cards at a time to find the matching pairs.
interface_implementations.learning_reinforcement: Enhances short-term memory and association recall through the classic concentration card game mechanic.

interface_implementations.description: Flash an item from list_1 on the screen. The user must quickly press one of two buttons, labeled with the categories from list_2, before time runs out.
interface_implementations.learning_reinforcement: Builds rapid-response classification skills and automates the association process under time constraints.

activity_data.question: Which gas do plants primarily use for photosynthesis?

interface_implementations.description: Display the question and the options as a list of radio buttons or clickable boxes. The user selects one answer and submits.
interface_implementations.learning_reinforcement: Tests recognition and recall of specific facts in a straightforward, universally understood format.

interface_implementations.description: Show all options. The user clicks to eliminate incorrect answers one by one until only the correct one remains.
interface_implementations.learning_reinforcement: Encourages process of elimination and builds confidence by allowing the user to discard definite non-answers first.

interface_implementations.description: Display the prompt with an empty text field where the user types their answer directly into the field.
interface_implementations.learning_reinforcement: Promotes active recall rather than simple recognition, as the user must generate the answer from memory.

interface_implementations.description: Show the prompt with a blank space. Provide a list of possible answers (including distractors) that the user can drag and drop into the blank.
interface_implementations.learning_reinforcement: Provides scaffolding for learners by offering a set of choices, reducing the cognitive load of pure recall.

interface_implementations.description: Replace the blank in the prompt with a dropdown menu containing the correct answer and several incorrect options.
interface_implementations.learning_reinforcement: Acts as a middle ground between open recall and multiple choice, useful for guiding the user towards the correct concept.

activity_data.prompt: Arrange the first four stages of the water cycle, starting with water on Earth's surface.

interface_implementations.description: Display the items in a shuffled order. The user drags and drops them into the correct sequence in a designated area.
interface_implementations.learning_reinforcement: Reinforces understanding of processes and timelines through direct manipulation and visualization of order.

interface_implementations.description: Show a pool of unordered items. The user clicks on them one by one in the correct sequence to build the ordered list.
interface_implementations.learning_reinforcement: Focuses on recall of sequence by having the user actively construct the correct order from scratch.

interface_implementations.description: Present the items in a random order, each with a text box next to it. The user must type the correct sequence number (1, 2, 3, etc.) for each item.
interface_implementations.learning_reinforcement: Tests memory of sequential information and requires the user to mentally map the entire process at once.

activity_data.statement: The Earth is the fourth planet from the Sun.

interface_implementations.description: Display the statement with two prominent buttons labeled 'True' and 'False'. The user selects one.
interface_implementations.learning_reinforcement: Provides a quick and direct way to assess factual knowledge and address common misconceptions.

interface_implementations.description: Present the statement on a card. The user swipes the card right for 'True' or left for 'False'.
interface_implementations.learning_reinforcement: Gamifies the assessment of facts, making rapid-fire quizzing more engaging and interactive.

interface_implementations.description: Show the statement and ask the user to respond by clicking a 'Thumbs Up' (True) or 'Thumbs Down' (False) icon.
interface_implementations.learning_reinforcement: Uses intuitive, universal symbols to test binary propositions, lowering the cognitive barrier for response.

activity_data.prompt: Identify the nucleus in the animal cell diagram.

interface_implementations.description: Display the image and the prompt. The user must click on the correct region of the image. A click within the defined hotspot is marked as correct.
interface_implementations.learning_reinforcement: Develops visual identification and spatial reasoning skills by requiring the user to locate a specific part within a larger context.

interface_implementations.description: Present the image with several empty target markers on different organelles. The user must drag the correct label ('Nucleus') from a word bank onto the target marker on the nucleus.
interface_implementations.learning_reinforcement: Tests knowledge of terminology and its association with visual representations, suitable for learning multiple parts at once.

activity_data.text_template: A right triangle has one angle that is exactly [BLANK_1] degrees. The side opposite this angle is called the [BLANK_2].

interface_implementations.description: Display the paragraph with empty boxes for blanks. The user drags words from the provided word bank into the correct boxes.
interface_implementations.learning_reinforcement: Strengthens understanding of concepts in context and provides scaffolding by offering choices, reducing the chance of spelling errors.

interface_implementations.description: Each blank in the text is a dropdown menu containing all the words from the word bank. The user selects the correct word for each blank.
interface_implementations.learning_reinforcement: Allows the user to focus on a single choice at a time while still seeing the full context of the sentence, reinforcing relationships between concepts.

interface_implementations.description: Each blank is an active text input field. The user must type the correct answers directly into the paragraph.
interface_implementations.learning_reinforcement: Maximizes recall challenge by requiring the user to generate and spell the correct terms from memory within a contextual framework.
